intro: Hieracium tenuiglandulosum, commonly known as the slender glandular hawkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy, upright stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine glands. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often blooming from June to September. Hieracium tenuiglandulosum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
